stories.text:
Screenwriters, songwriters, and authors can obtain lifetime residuals for a script, song, or book they wrote forever and half ago. Most coders/engineers however are payed for the length of their usefulness on a project or in a job, whether on a contract or full-time salary. Coding is as much of an art as it is a science and it seems to me that it should have the same right to be compensated like an art.

If one wanted to move to a royalty system for usage of source code or compiled binaries, how would one go about enforcing it? Pay per compilation? Pay per opening of the compiled program?
stories.title: How would a royalty system work for software?
